title: Mario Testino’s Celeb-Filled New Book Explores the “Allure of Men” (NSFW)
text:
Visit the original post to see all 29 images from this gallery. 
Mario Testino has released his largest book to date, titled SIR, featuring more than 300 images taken by the renowned photographer in his search to define the “allure of men.”
“The way men are seen in photography, in fashion, and the way that men look at pictures of themselves has changed in recent years,” says Testino in the press release. “It is a subject that has come into focus: The masculine image, a man’s personal style, changing attitudes to the male face and body.”
THE ONE AND ONLY MR. LAGERFELD FEATURES IN MY BOOK 'SIR', OUT TODAY IN SOFT COVER! EL ÚNICO SR LAGERFELD DESTACADO EN MI LIBRO 'SIR' QUE SALE HOY EN TAPA BLANDA! See link in bio. @KarlLagerfeld @Taschen #MarioTestino #TestinoArchive #KarlLagerfeld #Taschen 
A photo posted by MARIO TESTINO (@mariotestino) on Dec 15, 2016 at 1:55pm PST 

The book features an essay by Pierre Borhan, an interview with Patrick Kinmonth, and many previously unpublished works from Testino’s archive of thousands. Costume, tradition, gender play, portraiture, photojournalism, and fashion all collide as Testino observes masculinity through the “dandy and the gentleman, the macho and the fey, the world-famous face to the unknown passerby.”
Photographs include studies of Brad Pitt, George Clooney, Jude Law and Colin Firth, David Beckham, David Bowie, Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and more.
Check out our preview of the book above, then head over to TASCHEN to cop for $798.
